name: run-cmake
description: Run CMake (and optionally vcpkg and Ninja) with a CMakeLists.txt or with CMakeSettings.json created with Visual Studio
author: Luca Cappa

inputs.name: cmakeListsOrSettingsJson
inputs.label: Mode:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select between targeting a CMakeLists.txt, or leveraging a CMakeSettings.json file of Visual Studio.

inputs.name: useVcpkgToolchainFile
inputs.label: Use vcpkg.cmake toolchain if the VCPKG_ROOT environment variable is defined.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Indicates whether to use vcpkg's CMake toolchain file if VCPKG_ROOT environment variable is defined. If there is already a toolchain.cmake file passed in, that will be passed in with '-DVCPKG_CHAINLOAD_TOOLCHAIN_FILE=/path/to/toolchain.cmake'.

inputs.name: vcpkgTriplet
inputs.label: vcpkg triplet:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the triplet used with vcpkg. The task 'Run vcpkg' sets the used one in VCPKG_TRIPLET environment variable. Possible values are any file name with no extension present in the vcpkgroot/trplet directory, e.g. x64-linux, x64-windows, x64-osx and so forth.

inputs.name: cmakeBuildType
inputs.label: CMake Build type:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the build configuration, typically Debug or Release.

inputs.name: cmakeGenerator
inputs.label: Generator:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the CMake generator to be used.

inputs.name: buildDirectory
inputs.label: Build directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Override the build directory, i.e. where CMake is run. Default for CMakeLists.txt is the $(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory). For CMakeSettings.json the build directory is defined in the JSON file.

inputs.name: cmakeAppendedArgs
inputs.label: CMake arguments:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provides a mean to provide all the CMake arguments. This is required when using CMakeLists.txt in Advanced mode. For CMakeSettings.json, the arguments are already inferred, but you can append your arguments providing them here.

inputs.name: configurationRegexFilter
inputs.label: Configuration(s) regex filter:
inputs.helpMarkDown: The regular expression selects which CMakeSettings.json's configuration(s) to build, one or more.

inputs.name: ninjaPath
inputs.label: Ninja path:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Full path to ninja build tool. If not specified, the one in PATH environment variable will be used. If not available, it will be downloaded from Internet and used (only for Windows).

inputs.name: ninjaDownloadUrl
inputs.label: Ninja download URL:
inputs.helpMarkDown: URL to download ninja build tool from.

inputs.name: cmakeWrapperCommand
inputs.label: CMake wrapper command (e.g. emcmake):
inputs.helpMarkDown: The shell command that woud setup the environment and then invoke the cmake command. An example is 'emcmake' of Emscripten SDK.

inputs.name: buildWithCMake
inputs.label: Build after succesful CMake generation.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Indicates whether to run 'cmake --build' after CMake project files have been generated successfully.

inputs.name: buildWithCMakeArgs
inputs.label: Additional build args:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional build arguments such '-j4', '--config Debug', '--clean-first' and so forth. Separate CMake argument to the native make program arguments with '--' .
